items.title: European shares touch record high as markets resume post-holiday trading
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- European shares edged higher after the holidays, with STOXX 600 barely up and major indices mixed (DAX down ~0.2%, FTSE 100 and CAC 40 flat).
- Sectors: basic resources led gains on precious metals; tech and healthcare supported while defense/aerospace fell amid geopolitical comments; investors await Fed minutes and further rate-cut expectations.
- Notable mover: biotech Abivax rose about 3.2%.

items.title: Central bank chief urges Austria to rethink Mercosur deal opposition
items.author: Reuters

items.title: The tenuous peace between Trump and the $30 trillion US bond market
items.author: Davide Barbuscia
items.summary:
- Trump tariffs sparked a bond-market revolt; the truce is fragile as deficits and $30T of debt keep yields and term premia volatile.
- Treasury buybacks, short-dated debt, and crypto/stablecoins have cooled yields, but risk remains if inflation or Fed policy turns hawkish.
- Barbuscia presents a macro fixed-income view of the tug-of-war between deficits, investors, and policy.

items.title: South African rand softens as bullion prices take a breather
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Rand weakened to 16.7025 per dollar in early trade, down about 0.3%, as investors booked profits from a bullion rally.
- Gold eased from near-record highs and silver pulled back after breaching $80/oz, as safe-haven demand cooled.
- Longer-term metals outlook remains positive in a lower-rate global environment; rand on track for gains exceeding 12% this year.

items.title: Louis Gerstner, former IBM CEO who revitalized 'Big Blue,' dies at 83
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Led IBM from 1993–2002 as the first outsider CEO, guiding a wide turnaround.
- Shifted IBM toward business services, restructured culture, cut costs, and bought back stock, with IBM stock about eightfold higher by 2002.
- An author and philanthropist, he wrote Who Says Elephants Can't Dance and founded the Gerstner Philanthropies to support education and research.

items.title: More Israeli tech workers want to relocate abroad, report says
items.author: Steven Scheer
items.summary: - 53% of companies saw more relocation requests amid the ongoing conflict, risking local tech leadership.\n- The sector accounts for ~20% of GDP, 15% of jobs, and >50% of exports, with Microsoft, Intel, Nvidia, Amazon, Meta and Apple operating in Israel.\n- War disruptions push some multinationals to shift investments; rising executive relocation demand underscores the need for regulatory and geopolitical stability.

items.title: Amazon halts plans for drone delivery in Italy
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Amazon will not pursue commercial drone delivery in Italy after a strategic review, citing an unfavorable regulatory framework for its longer-term objectives.
- The company noted progress with regulators and said it had completed initial drone delivery tests in December 2024 in San Salvo, Abruzzo.
- ENAC called the decision unexpected; the current Italian regulatory environment is not conducive to continuing the project.

items.title: UK and Germany sign $70 million joint deal for mobile artillery systems
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Britain and Germany signed a joint procurement worth about $70 million to acquire the RCH 155 artillery system mounted on armoured vehicles, including a UK early capability demonstrator and two German test units.
- The system can fire eight rounds per minute on the move, is crewed by two and can travel about 700 km without refuelling.
- Built by KNDS and Rheinmetall, it is designed to strike targets beyond 70 km.

items.title: Libya's Waha Oil adds two gas wells to Farigh field
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Two new gas wells at the Farigh field are onstream, producing about 14 million and 12 million cubic feet of gas per day.
- Waha Oil is a joint venture between Libya's National Oil Corporation, TotalEnergies and ConocoPhillips.
- The development aims to meet local demand and bolster domestic gas supply.

items.title: Lloyds to shut invoice factoring unit by year's end, FT reports
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Lloyds Banking Group plans to shut its invoice factoring service by year-end, according to a Financial Times report.
- Reuters could not immediately verify the FT report.
- The move comes as Lloyds, Britain's largest mortgage lender, reassesses its business lines.

items.title: UK secures migrant return deal with Angola, Namibia; DRC faces visa curbs
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Angola and Namibia agreed to take back their migrants and criminals after the UK threatened visa penalties for non-cooperation.
- The Democratic Republic of the Congo could face wider visa restrictions and loss of fast-track services if cooperation does not improve quickly.
- The moves are part of UK reforms to make refugee status temporary and speed up deportations, with more than 50,000 removed since July.

items.title: India's Zepto files for IPO as quick-commerce race heats up
items.author: Reuters

items.title: Waymo's San Francisco outage raises doubts over robotaxi readiness during crises
items.author: Abhirup Roy

items.title: China issues draft rules to regulate AI with human-like interaction
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- China’s cyberspace regulator issued draft rules to regulate AI services that imitate human personalities and engage users emotionally, for consumer AI products that mimic traits and interact via text, images, audio or video.
- Providers would bear safety responsibilities, require algorithm review, strengthen data security and personal data protection, and monitor for addiction with intervention as needed.
- Content red lines would bar outputs that endanger national security, spread rumors, or promote violence or obscenity, and require assessing user states to intervene in extreme emotions or addictive behavior.

items.title: Winter weather in US Northeast leads to thousands of flight delays, cancellations
items.author: Maria Tsvetkova, Rich McKay

items.title: Silver rises 9% to hit fresh record high
items.author: Reuters

items.title: Large Brazilian union rejects Petrobras proposal to end strike
items.author: Fabio Teixeira, Rodrigo Viga Gaier
items.summary:
- Sindipetro-NF, the largest union within FUP, rejected Petrobras’ offer to end the 12-day strike, even as the rest of FUP approved it.
- With Sindipetro-NF opposing, protests continue at several sites; FNP also urged unions to keep protesting.
- The dispute centers on pension funds and pensioner deductions, with Campos basin platforms affected, though Petrobras says production remains unaffected due to contingency crews.

items.title: New York to require social media platforms to display mental health warnings
items.author: Jasper Ward
items.summary: - New York will require platforms with infinite scroll or auto-play to display warning labels about potential harm to young users’ mental health, with penalties up to $5,000 per violation. - The measure applies to conduct in New York and lets the attorney general pursue civil penalties; it follows other states and a 2023 Surgeon General advisory. - TikTok, Snap, Meta, and Alphabet did not comment; Australia recently banned under-16s as part of global concern over youth mental health.

items.title: Former ULA CEO Tory Bruno to join Blue Origin's new national security business
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Tory Bruno, former ULA CEO, named president of Blue Origin's National Security Group to lead the defense and intelligence launch business.
- He will report to CEO Dave Limp and aim to expand Blue Origin's role in U.S. military contracts and compete with SpaceX.
- Blue Origin supplies BE-4 engines to ULA for the Vulcan rocket, tying the two as propulsion partners and market competitors.

items.title: US airlines cancel over 1,000 flights due to winter storm Devin
items.author: Reuters

items.title: Atos to sell Latin American businesses to Brazil's Semantix
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Atos signed a binding agreement to sell its Latin American operations to Brazilian tech firm Semantix, covering about 2,800 employees across Brazil, Argentina, Chile, Colombia, Peru and Uruguay.
- Financial terms were undisclosed, with a closing expected in coming months, as part of Atos' restructuring after 2024 troubles that saw roughly €2.1 billion of debt trimmed and banks/bondholders gaining stake.
- The deal is in line with Atos' asset-sale–driven turnaround strategy.

items.title: Target faces activist investor pressure amid sales decline, FT reports
items.author: Siddharth Cavale
items.summary:
- Activist TCIM has built a stake in Target, adding pressure as Target’s sales lag peers.
- Incoming CEO Michael Fiddelke starts in February; governance changes urged with calls for an independent chairman; stock up about 2.6% on the news but down over 28% this year.
- Target plans to invest an extra $1B in 2026 for store openings/remodels; UBS pegs real estate ownership at ~75%; analysts say a retail fundamentals revamp is needed, not just financial engineering.

items.title: ASIA GOLD Record gold rally cools Indian buying; China discounts narrow
items.author: Sherin Varghese, Rajendra Jadhav
items.summary:
- India’s domestic gold hit a record 139,286 rupees/10g with spot near $4,530.60/oz, driven by speculative buying and rate-cut expectations; dealers offered discounts up to $61/oz over official prices.
- In China, discounts narrowed to $15–$30/oz from $64, aided by a firmer yuan; weak retail demand persists despite rate-cut hopes and limited imports.
- Regional notes: Singapore premiums $0.50–$3.50/oz; Hong Kong at parity to a $2/oz premium; Japan discounts $0.50–$6/oz; festive travel dampens Indian purchases.

items.title: Silver tops $75 as gold and platinum surge to records
items.author: Sherin Varghese

items.title: Platinum hits record high on tight supply, EU combustion-engine ban reversal
items.author: Reuters
items.summary:
- Platinum hits an all-time high at $2,413.62/oz by 03:04 GMT, up 8% and on track for its largest annual gain.
- The rally is driven by tight supply and a surprise EU reversal of the 2035 combustion-engine ban.
- Investor funds are moving away from gold into platinum, supporting the rally.
